Description: Limestone bas-relief of a Hathor head. The head of Hathor shows the goddess wearing a long wig, and she is depicted with cow ears. The top of her crown is now missing on the left side. Her eyes are extremely narrow, with the right eye particularly slim compared to the left. Her eyebrows are conveyed in slight sunken relief, and her nose is extremely broad at the tip. Her lips are pursed together, and her chin is slightly chipped. The edges of the wig and her neck are slightly damaged. There are small chips to the stone across all sides. The object is now supported on a thick modern base.
Curator's comments: The triangular shape of Hathor’s face and the wide facial features are stylistically similar to 26th Dynasty representations of the goddess, for instance in surviving column capitals from the site of Sais.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (?)
